com.brightcove.mobile.android
Class BCPlayerControls

java.lang.Object
  RelativeLayout
      com.brightcove.mobile.android.BCPlayerControls

public class BCPlayerControls
extends RelativeLayout

BCPlayerControls represents the fixed playback controls for the BCPlayerView in the Brightcove Android Player SDK.

Nested Class Summary
static interface BCPlayerControls.MediaPlayerControl
          Represents contract between player controls and BCPlayerView.

Constructor Detail

BCPlayerControls

public BCPlayerControls(Context pContext,
                        AttributeSet pAttrs)
Basic constructor to handle a given AttributeSet. The AttributeSet is not directly used by BCPlayerControls but is passed on to the parent RelativeLayout.

Parameters:
pContext - the current Context
pAttrs - the relevant AttributeSet from XML

BCPlayerControls

public BCPlayerControls(Context pContext)
Basic constructor to setup the BCPlayerControls view given a Context.

Parameters:
pContext - the current Context
Method Detail

onFinishInflate

public void onFinishInflate()

setMediaPlayer

public void setMediaPlayer(BCPlayerControls.MediaPlayerControl pPlayer)
Sets the MediaPlayer associated with these controls.

Parameters:
pPlayer - an implementation of MediaPlayerControl

makeControllerView

public View makeControllerView()
Create the view that holds the widgets that control playback. Derived classes can override this to create their own.

Returns:
The controller view

show

public void show()
Show the controller on screen. It will go away automatically after 3 seconds of inactivity.

show

public void show(int pTimeout)
Show the controller on screen. It will go away automatically after 'timeout' milliseconds of inactivity.

Parameters:
pTimeout - The timeout in milliseconds. Use 0 to show the controller until hide() is called.

onTouchEvent

public boolean onTouchEvent(MotionEvent pEvent)
Resets the timer to hide controls so that they stay visible longer on touch events.

isShowing

public boolean isShowing()
Indicates whether player controls are visible.

Returns:
true if controls are visible, false otherwise

hide

public void hide()
Hides the player controls from the screen.

stringForTime

protected java.lang.String stringForTime(int pTimeMs)
Builds a string to represent the given time for video playback or duration, suitable for display in player controls.

Parameters:
pTimeMs - the desired duration or position in milliseconds
Returns:
the formatted time String

dispatchKeyEvent

public boolean dispatchKeyEvent(KeyEvent event)
Handles basic hardware keyboard events.

doPauseResume

protected void doPauseResume()
Implements all required logic to pause or resume video. This calls updatePausePlay() to ensure UI is updated.
